description: Alberta Premier Danielle Smith said she’s appointing a group to negotiate with the Canadian government on removing laws that restrict energy production, adding that a referendum on the province separating from Canada may be on the ballot as soon as next year.
title: Alberta’s Smith Plans Talks With Carney, Says Separation Vote Possible

description: New Zealand’s governing National Party wants to restrict access to social media for those aged under 16 years, mirroring a move in Australia that sparked criticism from global tech giants.
title: New Zealand’s National Party Seeks Social Media Age Restrictions

description: The Trump Administration is declaring Harvard University ineligible for new research grants from the federal government in the latest escalation between the White House and the Ivy League school.
title: Trump Blocks Harvard From New Research Funding in Latest Blow

description: The US may need to spend up to $542 billion over 20 years to develop and launch a network of space-based interceptors, the Congressional Budget Office said, putting a rough cost estimate on an unproven part of President Donald Trump’s proposed “Golden Dome” defense system.
title: US Space-Based Missile Defense Could Cost $542 Billion, CBO Says

description: The Trump administration is focused on freeing up more electromagnetic spectrum to power wireless communication, the chairman of the Federal Communications Commission said on Monday, a move that could generate $80 billion in government revenue and help the US better compete with China.
title: FCC’s Carr Calls for Spectrum, AI Leadership in China Race

description: President Donald Trump signed an executive order looking to limit federal funding for gain-of-function research that involves altering pathogens, suggesting the efforts could have been responsible for the outbreak of the Covid-19 pandemic.
title: Trump Signs Order Targeting Gain-of-Function Virus Research

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Monday, Bloomberg Intelligence senior analyst Nathan Dean gives his insights into what’s been happening and what’s coming up in the nooks and crannies of government and markets.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s First Deals on Tariffs: How Soon Is Soon Enough?

description: The UK government will shortly unveil a new industrial policy for its film sector, as it reaffirms support for its creative industries after US President Donald Trump revealed plans to hit movies produced overseas with a 100% tariff.
title: UK Reaffirms Support for Film Industry After Trump Tariff Threat

description: Mehmet Oz, the US Centers for Medicaid and Medicare Services leader, suggested he supports reducing federal Medicaid funding for the millions of people who gained access to the program through the Affordable Care Act.
title: Mehmet Oz Questions Federal Funding for Medicaid Expansion

description: President Donald Trump said he would meet with Hollywood executives after confounding the US film industry over his plan to impose a 100% tariff on movies made overseas.
title: Trump Vows to Meet Hollywood on Tariff Plan That Shook Industry

description: TeleMessage is investigating a potential security incident after a hacker claimed to steal sensitive data from the app, which former National Security Adviser Michael Waltz allegedly used to communicate with other members of the Trump administration.
title: Messaging App Tied to Trump Cabinet Investigating Cyber Incident

description: President Donald Trump said the sliding price of oil is intensifying pressure on Russia and boosting the odds for a deal to end its war in Ukraine.
title: Dropping Oil Price Boosts Odds of Ukraine Peace Deal, Trump Says

description: The US Army is suspending helicopter training flights around the Pentagon and Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport as authorities investigate an incident last week that saw two passenger jets abort landings to avoid a Black Hawk in the area.
title: US Army Puts Chopper Training Flights Around Pentagon on Pause

description: President Donald Trump announced Washington will host the 2027 National Football League draft, saying it will provide a boost to the nation’s capital.
title: Trump Announces 2027 NFL Draft Will Be on DC’s National Mall

description: California warned that a plunge in international travel is set to hit tourism revenue after record spending from visitors last year.
title: California Warns of 9% Drop in Foreign Visits in Trump Backlash

description: Nigeria’s President Bola Tinubu plans to sign an executive order that will prioritize the procurement of goods and services from local firms, a move that bears some semblance to President Donald Trump’s “America First” agenda that champions US interests.
title: Nigeria’s Tinubu Set to Sign Order Prioritizing Local Industries

description: The Internal Revenue Service lost 31% of its auditors from buyouts and layoffs tied to Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency, departures that are likely to hamper the agency’s ability to go after tax cheats.
title: IRS Lost 31% of Tax Auditors in DOGE Downsizing, Watchdog Finds

description: The US sanctioned a militia in Myanmar linked to the ruling junta for supporting and profiting from cyber scams “on an industrial scale” that have cost Americans billions of dollars.
title: US Targets Junta-Linked Militia in Myanmar Over ‘Scam Compounds’

description: The US sanctioned a militia in Myanmar linked to the ruling junta for supporting and profiting from cyber scams “on an industrial scale” that have cost Americans billions of dollars.
title: US Targets Junta-Linked Militia in Myanmar Over ‘Scam Compounds’

description: The Trump administration is offering undocumented migrants $1,000 and paid travel if they agree to leave the US voluntarily, the latest effort to ramp up mass deportations and slash enforcement costs.
title: Trump Administration Offers Migrants $1,000 to Voluntarily Leave

description: President Donald Trump and his administration overstepped their authority by halting federal offshore and onshore wind approvals, 17 states and Washington, D.C., said in a lawsuit filed Monday in federal court.
title: New York Leads States Suing Over Trump’s Offshore Wind Pause

description: Pakistan alleged that India has almost entirely stopped the flow of water across the border through the Chenab river as fears of a clash between the two neighbors mount following a deadly attack in Kashmir.
title: Pakistan Says India Chokes River Flow as Fears of Conflict Rise

description: President Donald Trump said that he had spoken with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan and that his counterpart would visit Washington in the future.
title: Trump Speaks to Erdogan, Says Turkish Leader to Visit US

description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent touted the US as the “premier destination” for global capital and argued that the Trump administration’s policies will solidify that position — countering the so-called sell America theme that materialized last month.
title: Bessent Touts US as ‘Premier Destination’ for Global Capital

description: A bipartisan alliance backing stablecoin legislation shattered in the US Senate as a key group of Democrats threatened to filibuster a bill that Republicans had hoped to pass this month — unless “numerous” fixes are made.
title: Stablecoin Coalition Cracks as Democrats Threaten to Filibuster

description: Bill Ackman rattled off a list of concerns over how his alma mater Harvard University has handled the conflict with President Donald Trump, arguing it needs a change in board leadership.
title: Ackman Slams Harvard for Failures, Calls for Pritzker Exit

description: Romania’s prime minister will resign on Monday after a far-right opposition leader who aligned himself with Donald Trump scored a resounding first-round victory in the Black Sea nation’s presidential election.
title: Romanian Premier to Resign After Coalition Defeat in Vote

description: Task forces that specialize in fighting organized crime, drug cartels and human traffickers were told to shut down by Sept. 30, according to documents and people familiar with the matter
title: Trump Team Set to Dissolve Reagan-Era Transnational Crime Unit

description: A bipartisan group of members of Congress are seeking an additional $400 million from the federal government to help fund transportation improvements in US cities hosting the 2026 FIFA World Cup.
title: US Lawmakers Request $400 Million in Transit Aid for World Cup

description: Kosovo Prime Minister Albin Kurti reached out to an opposition party with a proposal to form a ruling coalition, seeking to break nearly three months of post-election deadlock.
title: Kosovo Premier Seeks to End Deadlock With Bid to Form Coalition

description: Senior royals have joined thousands of people in London to observe a military procession to begin commemorations marking the end of the Second World War in Europe.
title: Senior Royals Join Thousands in London as VE Day Commemorations Begin

description: Former centrist Prime Minister Edouard Philippe would be neck and neck with far-right National Rally leader Jordan Bardella in the race to become France’s next president in 2027, a poll of voting intentions showed.
title: French Poll Puts Philippe, Bardella in Tie in Presidential Vote

description: South Sudan’s government plans to dismiss First Vice President Riek Machar and haul him before a court if an ongoing investigation finds him complicit in renewed violence in the country, The East African reported, citing Information Minister Michael Makuei Lueth.
title: South Sudan May Dismiss Vice President, East African Reports

description: Germany’s main opposition party Alternative for Germany challenged a ruling by the nation’s domestic intelligence agency that classified it as a right-wing extremist movement.
title: Germany’s AfD Party Challenges Agency’s ‘Extremist’ Label

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: A Houthi Hitch in Trump’s Grand Mideast Plan

description: European Central Bank Governing Council member Fabio Panetta said a new wave of protectionism could damage economies around the world.
title: ECB’s Panetta Says Protectionism Threatens to Weaken Prosperity

description: Iran said it’s waiting for Oman to confirm when there will be a new round of nuclear talks with the US, while also saying it had nothing to do with Houthi missile strikes on Israel.
title: Iran Says Still Waiting to Hear When Next US Talks Will Happen

description: Romanian Prime Minister Marcel Ciolacu plans to offer his resignation after the country’s far-right opposition leader scored a resounding first-round victory in a presidential election on Sunday, according to a person familiar with the plan.
title: Romanian Prime Minister to Offer Resignation After Far-Right Win

description: Israel’s security cabinet voted to intensify military operations in Gaza and call up of tens of thousands of extra reservists, while also deciding on a means of distributing aid in the Palestinian territory.
title: Israel Vows to Step Up Gaza Fighting Ahead of Trump’s Gulf Trip

description: Saudi Arabia’s progress in securing investment in two oil refineries in India is being held back by a lack of consensus around crude supply, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Saudi Push Into Indian Refining Is Stalling Over Crude Supply

description: The European Union is set to propose measures to ban Russian gas imports by the end of 2027, as the bloc pushes to sever ties with the country that was once its biggest energy supplier.
title: EU Set to Propose Banning Russian Gas Imports by End of 2027

description: India and Pakistan are the closest they’ve been to military conflict in years following last month’s devastating attack on Indian tourists in Kashmir. The turmoil couldn’t come at a worse time for the economies of the two nuclear-armed nations.
title: India and Pakistan Edge Toward a Conflict Neither Can Afford

description: The key personnel appointments in Germany’s new government are now complete after the Social Democrats opted for a mix of veterans and newcomers for their cabinet members as pressure builds on the ruling coalition under conservative Chancellor Friedrich Merz to tackle the country’s challenges.
title: Germany’s Incoming Cabinet Under Merz: Meet the Key Members

description: India recalled its top representative to the International Monetary Fund, a former adviser to Prime Minister Narendra Modi who publicly criticized the fund’s analysis.
title: India Removes Top Envoy to IMF Who Criticized Fund’s Analysis

description: Elon Musk called the US government inefficient and said artificial intelligence should be used to replace the functions currently done by some public workers, according to a person who attended the closed-door session at the Milken Institute Global Conference.
title: Musk at Milken Says AI Can Offset Losing Some Government Workers

description: Asian finance ministers and central bankers called for unity and reaffirmed their commitment to fair and free trade amid rising protectionism that they said weighs on the global economy.
title: Asian Finance Chiefs Call for Regional Unity Amid Tariff Talks

description: Iron ore billionaire Gina Rinehart, Australia’s richest person and a major donor to the nation’s center-right Liberal Party, urged the country’s conservatives to stare down the weekend’s election wipe-out and lean in to policies like those of US President Donald Trump.
title: Billionaire Rinehart Urges Australian Right to Embrace Trump

description: US President Donald Trump has praised his “very good relationship” with Australia’s Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, who defeated an opponent seen by voters as too similar to the American leader in an election on Saturday.
title: Trump Praises ‘Good Relationship’ With Australia’s Re-Elected PM Albanese

description: Representatives for Indian billionaire Gautam Adani and his companies met Trump administration officials about dismissing the criminal charges levied against him in an overseas bribery probe, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Adani Camp Meets Trump Officials in Push to End US Bribery Cases

description: President Donald Trump suggested that his administration could strike trade deals with some countries as soon as this week, offering the prospect of relief for trading partners seeking to avoid higher US import duties.
title: Trump Suggests Some Trade Deals May Come as Early as This Week

description: President Donald Trump announced Sunday that he plans to impose a 100% tariff on films produced overseas, extending his restrictive trade policies on US imports to the entertainment sector for the first time.
title: Trump Plans 100% Tariff on Foreign Movies, Escalating Trade War
